revised_title: Temperature and Pressure Effects on Thermal Conductivities of Electrical Insulators
tldr: This study investigates the effects of temperature and pressure on the thermal conductivities of various electrical insulators, including ice, glycerine, aniline, paraffin wax, naphthaline, aniline, nitrophenol, and diphenylamine. The results show a marked increase in the conductivities of ice, naphthaline, aniline, and nitrophenol at low temperatures, while glycerine has a maximum conductivity around 0°C. Paraffin wax exhibits a similar tendency.
